image.altText: Child drawing with crayons

props.synopsis: Almost three quarters of a billion dollars will be sunk into early childhood learning in South Australia as the state moves to implement the recommendations of the recent royal commission, including the rollout of universal preschool for three-year-olds.

title.children: Major funding pledge for preschool in SA following Gillard royal commission

image.altText: Brett Allford wearing a black hat and black sunglasses

props.synopsis: A former South Australian cricket and football umpire has been jailed for sending Uber Eats and make-up to overseas girls in exchange for sexual photos – with his youngest victim being 11-years-old.

title.children: Former SA sporting umpire jailed for sending gifts to girls in exchange for sexual images

image.altText: A man looks out to sea from a sandy beach with dunes behind him

props.synopsis: In South Australia, parts of the Coorong's coast are undergoing "incredible rates of change" due to climate change. What does that mean for more urbanised parts of our coast?

title.children: Rapidly disappearing Coorong coastline sparks warning for Australian coastal communities

image.altText: A young woman wearing a black shirt and green and yellow gloves cleans a glass sliding door from inside a house.

props.synopsis: The Fair Work Commission has announced Australia's minimum wage and award wages will increase by 3.75 per cent, taking the national minimum wage to $24.10 per hour or $915.91 per week from July 1.

title.children: Danielle is one of 2.6 million workers who will receive a pay rise next month

image.altText: Wide angle picture looking up through long grasses to a high-voltage power line with the sun setting in the background

props.synopsis: Across Australia, huge numbers of consumers are slowly waking up to the presence of mysterious new power charges on their bills.

title.children: Charged a month for 'moment' of demand: Consumers angry at 'mysterious' power tariffs

image.altText: A close up of Greg Lynn standing in front of a body of water near some rocks.

props.synopsis: In a police interview played in court, accused murderer Greg Lynn details his account of how campers Russell Hill and Carol Clay's lives ended in Victoria's High Country.

title.children: 'What am I gonna do': Pilot's panicked moments after campers' deaths detailed to court

image.altText: Houses in Brisbane street

props.synopsis: Data from CoreLogic shows house prices increased for the 16th straight month in May. Here's what property prices look like across the country.

title.children: Property prices increased again in May. Here's what the housing market looks like where you live

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump speaking with pursed lips

props.synopsis: Exclusive polling for the ABC's Q+A by YouGov reveals what Australians really think about global challenges, from Gaza to Ukraine and the US election.

title.children: What Australians really think of Donald Trump and foreign wars

image.altText: Journalist Antoinette Lattouf outside the fair work commission talking to the media

props.synopsis: Journalist and presenter Antoinette Lattouf was sacked by the ABC when she was taken off air part way through a radio presenting stint, the Fair Work Commission has found.

title.children: Journalist Antoinette Lattouf was sacked by ABC, Fair Work Commission finds

image.altText: A man speaking with his arm raised, standing at a green seat.

props.synopsis: Andrew Giles says he was relying on information given to him by his department when he told media last week that drones were being used to monitor the 151 ex-detainees released after a High Court case last year. Follow live.

title.children: Immigration minister says there were never any drones used to track ex-detainees, cancels 30 visas

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Amelia Hamer releases statement following Frydenberg fracas
PM brings out favourite prop as he calls time on QT
Greens lob Donald Trump question to PM

image.altText: Shorten looks serious, standing in profile, a painting just visible behind him.

props.synopsis: A speech writer will be paid about $600,000 over two years to assist government minister Bill Shorten, despite Services Australia saying it has existing capacity to provide help.

title.children: Taxpayers forking out $600,000 for Bill Shorten's speechwriter over two years

image.altText: A woman in a black leotard sits smiling.

props.synopsis: Best known for her eccentric 1970s aerobics TV program, firebrand Sue Becker went on to grill prime ministers and make a mark on the airwaves with her distinctive gravelly voice.

title.children: Aerobics TV star Sue Becker was also a talkback radio host 'way ahead of her time'

image.altText: A woman stands in the shallow water of a spring with a man crouching on the ground further behind her

props.synopsis: Unique species of fish, snails, and crustaceans have existed on this isolated property in Western Queensland since the dinosaur age when it was deep under water as part of the Eromanga Sea.

title.children: Newly protected reserve on former outback cattle station home to 37 species found nowhere else in the world

image.altText: Cage-diving with a big shark

props.synopsis: Shark fatalities on a remote coastline west of Adelaide accounted for 30 per cent of all shark deaths last year. But while other states pour millions of dollars into mitigation programs, the SA government says it is still working on a plan.

title.children: As mitigation programs ramp up elsewhere, this shark attack hotspot still goes without

image.altText: Dr Max Mollenkopf smiles while standing on the footpath of a quiet Newcastle street on a bright, sunny day.

props.synopsis: Newcastle GP Max Mollenkopf says unnecessary appointments for medical certificates are wasting doctors' time.

title.children: Why this GP wants employers to stop asking for medical certificates

image.altText: Deborah Conway and video still composite image

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian woman has been charged with allegedly assaulting a pro-Palestinian protester during a performance by Deborah Conway in Hobart last month.

title.children: Deborah Conway concert goer charged with assault over incident with pro-Palestinian protester

image.altText: A couple sit in a vehicle with their seatbelts on.

props.synopsis: Families of truck drivers worry every time they hear of a crash. Recent high-profile accidents on Australian roads involving heavy vehicles have highlighted concerns about the safety of the transport industry.

title.children: 'I almost died': Many truckies face near misses every week

image.altText: Search team on top of rubble from Whalan house explosion. Neighbouring house still standing behind them

props.synopsis: A body of a woman is found following a delicate and complex search in the rubble of a townhouse that exploded in Sydney's west on Saturday.

title.children: Search crews find woman's body in rubble of Sydney townhouse explosion

image.altText: A police man stands on a suburban street behind police tape.

props.synopsis: A 33-year-old man arrested in dramatic fashion after a car chase north of Perth is charged with the murder of his 61-year-old mother in the outer Perth suburb of Byford.

title.children: Son charged with murder of mother after dramatic highway arrest north of Perth

image.altText: Five Cold Chisel band members sit in connected waiting room chairs. A pokie machine in front of them on the floor

props.synopsis: Cold Chisel went from a 'reckless' band unfit for radio plays to rock legends who've transcended the generations. This is why the Aussie band continues to be the soundtrack of our lives.

title.children: Radio called Cold Chisel 'unplayable'. Then Khe Sanh sent them on the road to rock legend status

image.altText: woman in black jacket gives inquiry evidence behind microphone

props.synopsis: A senior lawyer at the heart of the disastrous and deadly Robodebt scheme resigns after questions are raised as to why she kept her Commonwealth job while contracted with another legal firm.

title.children: Senior government lawyer at heart of Robodebt scheme resigns after being discovered consulting with outside firm

image.altText: Police crime scene tape infront of police officers.

props.synopsis: Canberra man Manfred Uhle, 86, who is accused of stabbing his 78-year-old wife Wanda Uhle to death in the couple's Gordon home on Sunday, is ordered to undertake a mental health assessment after being charged with her murder.

title.children: Canberra man charged with murder after 78-year-old wife found with multiple stab wounds

image.altText: Lisa Weightman and Jessica Stenson composite

props.synopsis: Athletics Australia had to defend its Paris 2024 Olympic Games selection policy after controversy reigned over the three-person women's team. But it could have been worse — where Australia had six women run under the qualification standard, Ethiopia had 98.

title.children: Australia's marathon selection has threatened to tear the sport apart. Here's why

image.altText: Footage of Chinese lunar lander successfully touching down on the Moon

props.synopsis: Footage of China's uncrewed spacecraft landing on the far side of the Moon has been released by Chinese media.

title.children: Footage shows China's spacecraft landing on far side of the Moon

image.altText: Kellie Ann Carmichael

props.synopsis: Victorian woman Kellie Ann Carmichael went missing after leaving a hostel in the Blue Mountains in 2001. Her remains have been found in bushland near Katoomba, with an investigation underway.

title.children: Remains found in Blue Mountains confirmed to be woman who went missing 23 years ago

image.altText: A close up image of Josh Frydenberg looking serious.

props.synopsis: Former treasurer Josh Frydenberg has shut down suggestions of a potential bid to reclaim his old federal seat of Kooyong, which would have required squeezing out the woman who had already won pre-selection for it.

title.children: Josh Frydenberg says he won't try to snatch Kooyong pre-selection from Liberal woman

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: Basic award and minimum wage rates will rise by 3.75%, starting July 1, while the ASX has opened strongly, up 0.8%. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Award and minimum wages to rise 3.75%, ASX up 0.8% on opening

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX up 0.7% heading into afternoon session
Wage decision in line with forecast wage growth, not inflationary: FWC
Breaking: Award wages and minimum wages up 3.75%

image.altText: A police officer stands with an official vehicle near the home.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating the circumstances surrounding the deaths of a man and his aunty in Brisbane's north.

title.children: Man shot aunty dead in Brisbane's north while mum was at the property, police say

image.altText: a woman and her daughter standing smiling together

props.synopsis: Amid all the health workers coming in and out of Harlow's hospital room after her brain surgery, one stood out to her – diminutive neurosurgeon Amelia Jardim.

title.children: 'I love Amelia and will shout it from the rooftops': Harlow's neurosurgeon did more than just repair her brain

image.altText: Natasha Ryan arrives outside Brisbane Supreme Court

props.synopsis: The body of the now 40-year-old Rockhampton woman, who made international headlines after she ran away from home at 14 and hid in her boyfriend's house for five years, is found at Rockhampton Golf Club after a search by police.

title.children: Body of former teenage runaway Natasha Ryan found after search in Rockhampton

image.altText: Northern Minerals

props.synopsis: Five companies with ties to major Chinese entities are ordered by Jim Chalmers to divest their shares in this remote Australian rare earths mine "to protect our national interest."

title.children: 'National interest' behind treasurer's orders to block Yuxiao Fund from Australian rare earth investments

image.altText: Justin Stein

props.synopsis: Justin Laurens Stein, 33, was called as a witness in his own defence after pleading not guilty to murdering nine-year-old schoolgirl Charlise Mutten in early 2022.

title.children: Man accused of murdering 9yo Charlise Mutten tells jury her mother shot schoolgirl dead

image.altText: A police officer's cap.

props.synopsis: Efforts to free up police officers for street duties will be ramped up in the upcoming SA budget, with money set aside for a new "digital police station" — but the opposition says the move amounts to little more than the creation of a website.

title.children: Police to shift from paperwork back to SA beat amid retention and recruitment battle

image.altText: three men smiling shirtless in front of beach

props.synopsis: Drivers may have their vehicles towed away if they park overnight near the Noosa National Park as the local council tries to reduce noise and rubbish complaints.

title.children: Illegal campers hit with tow-away threats as parking fines fail to deter overnight stays

image.altText: Three rows of various colourful spices piled high in tubs.

props.synopsis: Only about 3 per cent of spices found in your pantry are grown in Australia despite the nation's large agricultural industry, and a research team and a bunch of farmers want to change that.

title.children: Despite the country's large farming industry, very few spices are grown in Australia … until now
